messages.title: Standing Up for Real Change
messages.content: I was born and raised in Battersea. I hold the area close to my heart—as did my father who previously campaigned to save Battersea Town Hall (Battersea Arts Centre) from demolition by a Labour led council in the 60’s. I am now fighting to save Battersea Sports Centre from being closed and uprooted by the Conservatives. Legislation can be introduced to ensure affordable housing for all, care and dignity for the vulnerable and address education issues. Vote and trust in me on 7th May to uphold our democracy.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP wants a fairer Australian-style points-based system to decide who comes to work and settle here.
UKIP will scrap income tax on the minimum wage, scrap the bedroom tax, and scrap the tax on your children when you die.
UKIP will pour £3 billion a year extra into the NHS to keep it as a free public service, funded by scrapping our £55 million a day EU membership fee.
By stopping our EU membership fee and clawing back the £30 million a day spent on foreign aid, UKIP is the only party with money to spend at home.

issues.education: Legislation can be introduced to [...] address education issues.
